name: Stock Report Generator
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me get stock information and analysis reports.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that when I type either a stock code or a company name, the system will correctly recognize which stock I mean even if there are multiple similar names.
I expect the system to allow me to enter stock codes or names in a single input field rather than forcing me to choose between different input modes.
I expect the system to accept commonly used ticker formats and company name variants without requiring exact, case‑sensitive matches.
I expect the system to support searching and generating reports for multiple stocks within the same session without having to restart the process each time.
I assume that the stock information and analysis in the reports will focus on currently listed and actively traded stocks rather than delisted or illiquid ones.
I expect summarized stock information to show only the most essential data points instead of all available details.
I expect the summarized stock information to highlight key indicators such as current price, recent change, and basic performance metrics rather than narrative analysis.
I assume that the customizable reports will be composed of predefined content sections that I can include or exclude instead of writing free‑form analysis text myself.
I expect basic stock information in the report to cover essential identification and trading details rather than in‑depth technical or macroeconomic analysis.
I expect market trends in the report to be based on historical price and volume data over a recent time window rather than long‑term qualitative industry forecasts.
I expect the financial data in the report to be drawn from officially reported financial statements instead of user‑generated or unofficial sources.
I prefer that reports generated from my inputs always include some minimal core information even if I deselect most optional sections.
I expect to specify my reporting requirements through simple selections and inputs rather than writing complex queries or commands.
I expect that once I have chosen report content and format for a stock, I can reuse or adjust those choices easily for other stocks without starting from scratch.
I expect the process of choosing report content and formats to happen within a guided interface rather than through multiple disconnected pages.
I expect the automatic report generation to be triggered by a clear action, such as a button, after I finish entering stock identifiers and preferences.
I assume that the default report format will be a readable on‑screen layout that does not require downloading files to view the content.
I expect that different report formats will mainly change the layout and level of detail while keeping the underlying information consistent.
I expect the white background and navy components to be applied consistently across all pages and report views for a uniform appearance.
I expect the navy components, such as headings, navigation, and key controls, to stand out clearly against the white background for easy recognition.

URL: As a user, I want to search for stock information by stock codes or names so that I can find the stocks I am interested in.
As a user, I want to view summarized stock information so that I can quickly understand the key details.
As a user, I want to generate customized stock reports based on my requirements so that I can get analysis tailored to my needs.
As a user, I want to input stock codes or names so that the website can generate the corresponding reports.
As a user, I want to select report formats so that I can customize how my stock reports are presented.
As a user, I want to select report content so that I can include only the information that is relevant to me.
As a user, I want the website to automatically generate the corresponding reports so that I can save time and effort.
As a user, I want the reports to include basic stock information so that I can understand the fundamental details of a stock.
As a user, I want the reports to include market trends so that I can analyze how the stock is performing in the market.
As a user, I want the reports to include financial data so that I can make informed investment decisions.
As a user, I want the website to have a white background color so that the interface appears clean and readable.
As a user, I want the website components to be navy in color so that the interface has a consistent visual style.
instruction: Please implement a website for generating stock reports to provide stock information and analysis. The website should have the functionality to search and summarize stock information, and generate customized stock reports based on user requirements. Users should be able to input stock codes or names, select report formats and content, and the website will automatically generate the corresponding reports. The reports should include basic stock information, market trends, financial data, and more. Set the background color to white and the component color to navy.

name: Neighborhood Insights Mapper
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me compare key characteristics of different neighborhoods.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to be able to select and compare multiple neighborhoods or areas within a single session without re-entering my choices each time.
I expect to identify neighborhoods or areas using familiar geographic labels such as city, district, zip code, or named neighborhood boundaries.
I expect the system to support comparison of more than two neighborhoods at once so I can see patterns across several areas simultaneously.
I want the system to provide data at a consistent geographic granularity so that comparisons between areas are directly meaningful.
I assume the system will cover a sufficiently broad range of neighborhoods within the regions I am interested in, rather than just a few sample areas.
I want demographic data to include multiple commonly used population attributes rather than a single demographic indicator.
I want economic data to include several key financial indicators that allow a nuanced understanding of neighborhood economic conditions.
I want crime data to be organized into different types or categories of incidents so that safety levels can be compared more precisely.
I expect the data used for comparisons to be drawn from recent time periods so that neighborhood characteristics reflect current conditions.
I assume that demographic, economic, and crime information will be aligned by the same time frame when shown together to enable proper comparison.
I want to be able to interact with charts through actions such as hovering, clicking, or selecting ranges to reveal more detailed information.
I expect to filter and refine the displayed data by criteria such as time period, neighborhood, or data category without leaving the dashboard view.
I want changes I make to filters or selections to update the relevant charts and comparisons immediately within the dashboard.
I assume that customizing a dashboard layout will be done through direct manipulation actions like dragging, resizing, or rearranging visual components.
I want differences between neighborhoods to be clearly highlighted in the visualizations so that comparisons can be understood at a glance.
I expect charts to use consistent scales and legends when comparing neighborhoods so that visual comparisons are not misleading.
I want the dashboard to present multiple charts on a single screen so I can compare different types of data side by side.
I assume that each chart and panel will be labeled with clear titles and axis descriptions so I can interpret the neighborhood data without ambiguity.
I expect the default dashboard configuration to show a balanced overview of demographic, economic, and crime information before I customize it.

URL: As a user, I want to compare demographic data across different areas so that I can understand how populations differ between neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to compare economic data across different areas so that I can analyze financial conditions in various neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to compare crime data across different areas so that I can evaluate safety levels between neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to use data dashboards with interactive charts so that I can explore neighborhood data visually and in more detail.
As a user, I want customizable dashboard layouts so that I can arrange the charts and information in a way that best fits my needs.
instruction: Please implement a web-based neighborhood mapping application for comparing data across different areas. The application should allow users to compare demographic, economic, and crime data across different areas. The application should also include data dashboards with interactive charts and customizable layouts. Use ivory for the background and forest green for components.

name: Multi-Company Finance Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me view and manage financial information across multiple companies in one place.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each company will be uniquely identifiable in the system so that I can clearly distinguish and select companies when viewing or managing their financial data.
I expect to be able to select specific companies or groups of companies as input when generating consolidated reports or cross-company views.
I assume the system will recognize standard financial data elements (such as revenue, expenses, assets, liabilities) from each company as the basis for comparisons and consolidation.
I expect the dashboard to handle more than two companies at once so that multi-company analysis is not limited to pairwise comparisons.
I assume the system will cover both high-level summaries and detailed line-item financial data for each company within the same environment.
I expect the consolidated reports and comparisons to span all companies configured in the system by default, unless I explicitly filter them.
I want the dashboard to include key financial metrics and summaries that are commonly used to assess company performance, rather than only raw transaction data.
I expect consolidated reports to present aggregated financial figures that are already combined across companies, instead of requiring me to manually add up results.
I assume cross-company comparisons will be based on comparable metrics using a consistent currency and time period so that the results are meaningful.
I want company-specific views to include enough detailed information to trace how figures in consolidated reports are derived.
I expect to navigate from the multi-company overview down into individual company details without leaving the dashboard context.
I want to trigger report generation and comparisons directly from the dashboard rather than using a separate tool or application.
I assume I can choose parameters such as date ranges or reporting periods when generating financial reports and comparisons.
I expect the system to support iterative analysis, allowing me to adjust filters or company selections and immediately see updated views or reports.
I want the dashboard to present multi-company data in a layout that clearly separates individual company information from consolidated information.
I assume cross-company comparisons will be visually organized in a way that makes differences and similarities easy to spot, such as aligned tables or side-by-side sections.
I expect consolidated reports to be presented in a structured, readable format similar to traditional financial statements.
I want the mint cream background and teal-styled components to apply consistently across all dashboard screens and report views so that the visual design feels uniform.
I assume the chosen mint cream background and teal components will not interfere with the readability of financial figures and labels on the dashboard.

As a user, I want the dashboard to collect financial information from each company so that all relevant data is available in one place.
As a user, I want the dashboard to display financial information from each company so that I can see each company’s financial status.
As a user, I want the dashboard to provide consolidated reports so that I can see combined financial results across companies.
As a user, I want to perform cross-company comparisons so that I can analyze financial performance between companies.
As a user, I want to perform cross-company reporting so that I can generate reports that span multiple companies.
As a user, I want to browse financial data from each company so that I can review company-specific financial details.
As a user, I want to view consolidated reports so that I can understand overall financial performance across all companies.
As a user, I want to perform financial management using the dashboard so that I can oversee and control financial activities.
As a user, I want to perform financial reporting using the dashboard so that I can generate the financial reports I need.

instruction: Please implement a multi-company dashboard for managing and displaying financial data from multiple companies. The dashboard should be able to collect and display financial information from each company, provide consolidated reports, and support cross-company comparisons and reporting. Users should be able to browse financial data from each company, view consolidated reports, and perform financial management and reporting. Apply mint cream as the background; style all components with teal.

I expect the system to include both historical and upcoming basketball games to support my betting decisions.
I want team-level, player-level, and match-level data to all be included in the analysis scope.
I expect to be able to select specific teams, players, or matches as the focus of the analysis I am viewing.
I want to be able to specify a particular time range or season when browsing basketball data.
I want the system to present betting-relevant statistics such as scores, win–loss records, and player performance metrics rather than general basketball facts.
I expect match history to include final scores, dates, and participating teams so that past outcomes can be interpreted in a betting context.
I want team rankings to reflect competitive strength based on recent performance rather than only long-term historical records.
I expect player performance information to include recent form and consistency, not just career averages.
I want match predictions to be derived from underlying data and analysis rather than being purely subjective opinions.
I expect betting recommendations to be tied explicitly to available betting options such as moneyline, spread, or totals.
I want to navigate through different types of basketball data, such as match history, team rankings, and player performance, using the same website interface.
I prefer to explore the analysis results interactively rather than only receiving a single static recommendation.
I want to be able to drill down from high-level summaries into more detailed statistics when something in the data catches my attention.
I expect to be able to move back and forth between data views and betting recommendations without losing my place or context.
I prefer data visualizations such as charts or graphs over raw tables when interpreting trends in basketball betting data.
I want visualizations and numeric data for the same information to be shown together so that I can cross-check what I see.
I expect the color scheme with a ghost white background and slate gray components to be applied consistently across all pages and views of the website.
I want the ghost white background and slate gray components to provide sufficient contrast so that betting data and visualizations remain easy to read.
I prefer a layout where match predictions, betting recommendations, and supporting data are visually grouped so I can quickly connect them when making decisions.

name: Regulatory Policy Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me easily understand and analyze complex regulatory policies.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify regulatory policies primarily by attributes such as jurisdiction, sector, topic, and date rather than by internal IDs or technical codes.
I want to be able to select regulatory policies from a list or catalog rather than having to manually input full policy details myself.
I expect the system to cover multiple regulatory policies at once so I can move between them without leaving the analysis environment.
I want to be able to limit my work to a subset of policies that match my interests instead of always seeing the entire set of available regulations.
I expect each regulatory policy entry to include both a human‑readable summary and the original policy text so I can understand details while retaining authoritative wording.
I want the system to include structured metadata for each policy, such as effective dates, responsible authority, and status, to support my analysis.
I expect the related data shown with a policy to include quantitative indicators such as metrics, counts, or historical trends that help explain the policy’s impact or context.
I want the charts and visualizations to be derived from the same underlying policy and contextual data that I am viewing in textual form.
I expect to navigate between the textual policy view and its visualizations through simple interactions such as clicking or tapping within the same interface.
I want to interactively adjust filters and immediately see the list of displayed policies update without needing to reload the page or start a new query.
I expect sorting options to be accessible through simple controls such as dropdowns or column headers that can be changed at any time while browsing.
I want to be able to switch back and forth between different sorting criteria without losing my current filter settings.
I expect to be able to click on a policy from a list or visualization to open a more detailed view of that specific policy and its related data.
I want policy information to be presented in a structured layout where the main policy text, related data, and visualizations are clearly separated but visible together.
I expect data visualizations and charts to use clear labels, legends, and axes so that I can interpret them without needing external explanations.
I want the list of regulatory policies to be presented in a tabular or card‑based format that makes it easy to scan key attributes at a glance.
I expect filters and sorting controls to be displayed close to the list of policies so that their effect on the displayed content is obvious.
I want the system to visually emphasize which filters and sorting options are currently active so I always understand why particular policies are being shown.

name: Solar Monitoring Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me understand and track my solar energy performance over time.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the system will uniquely identify and connect to my specific solar installation as the single data source for all measurements.

I expect the system to automatically obtain real-time values for solar generation, power consumption, and battery level from my existing solar hardware or monitoring gateway without requiring manual data entry.
I want all solar performance metrics in the system to be limited to my own property and not aggregated with data from other users or locations.
I expect historical data to be stored for a sufficiently long period to allow analysis of seasonal and long-term trends, not just a few recent days.
I want both generation and consumption data to be available at the same time intervals so they can be meaningfully compared over time.
I assume historical queries can be limited to user-specified date ranges so that I do not always have to scan the entire data history.
I want real-time solar power generation and consumption data to be displayed using standard power and energy units that I can easily interpret, such as watts and kilowatts.
I expect the battery level to be shown as a percentage value rather than only as raw voltage or other technical metrics.
I want historical trend views to include both solar generation and power consumption within the same analytical context so I can compare them directly.
I expect the charts to display time on one axis and the chosen solar metrics on the other axis so that trends over time are clear.
I assume the system will distinguish between different types of data series in charts, such as generation, consumption, and battery level, so I can tell them apart easily.
I want to be able to select which metric or combination of metrics is shown in a chart so I can focus on the specific aspect of solar performance I am analyzing.
I expect that interacting with charts, such as hovering or tapping, will reveal precise numeric values for specific points in time.
I assume I can switch between real-time views and historical analysis views within the same dashboard without needing a completely separate application.
I want to initiate historical data queries through simple controls such as date pickers or predefined time-range buttons rather than typing complex commands.
I want all primary dashboard screens where solar data is monitored and analyzed to share the same honeydew background color for a consistent look.
I expect key dashboard components such as panels, cards, and chart containers to use dark olive green as their main accent or foreground color to maintain a cohesive theme.
I assume that text and graphical elements will be styled so that the honeydew background and dark olive green components remain legible and visually distinct.
I want the real-time metrics and charts to be presented on a single dashboard view so that I can see the overall solar performance at a glance.

name: Online Texas Hold'em Platform
initial_requirements: I need an online system where people can gather to play Texas Hold'em poker with others.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify game rooms in the lobby by a clear room name or label so that I can distinguish between different tables.
I expect to identify myself in the system through a unique player identity, such as a username or display name, that other players can see in game rooms.
I expect to select game rooms and features in the lobby primarily through mouse or touch clicks on visible UI elements rather than through manual text input.
I expect the poker table to visually identify my own seat and cards distinctly from those of other players.
I assume that all poker games in the system follow the standard rules of Texas Hold'em without mixing in other poker variants.
I expect that all interactions related to game rooms, gameplay, chat, records, and account management occur within a single integrated online system.
I assume that a game room is dedicated to a single Texas Hold'em table at a time rather than supporting multiple tables in one room.
I expect that the system supports both newly starting games and games that are already in progress when I browse available rooms.
I expect each game room entry in the lobby to show enough status details, such as whether a game is waiting for players or currently playing, to help me decide whether to join.
I expect the player information shown in the lobby for each room to include at least the number of players and their identifiers so that I know who is at the table.
I expect my player hand cards to be visible only to me and not to other players at the table.
I expect community cards to be visible to all players seated at the table as shared information.
I expect the betting information at the table to include the current pot size and each player’s current bet or contribution in the ongoing hand.
I expect the available action buttons to reflect only the actions that are valid at my current turn, such as betting, calling, raising, checking, or folding.
I expect chat messages to be associated with the specific game room or table where I am currently playing rather than spanning unrelated rooms.
I expect my game records to include at least basic information such as date, game room or table, and outcome so I can meaningfully review my performance.
I expect account management to cover personal profile details and configurable settings relevant to my experience in the poker system.
I expect to interact with the poker system entirely through my web browser without needing to install additional desktop applications.
I expect navigation from the lobby to a selected game room or feature to occur via straightforward clicks on lobby items or menu entries.
I expect joining or creating a game room to result in an immediate transition to the corresponding poker table view where I can start playing.
I expect that when it is my turn to act at the table, the system will clearly indicate my turn and allow me to choose an action using on-screen buttons.
I expect chat input to be entered through a simple text field with a send action so I can communicate in real time during the game.
I expect viewing my game records and managing my account information to be accessible from the main interface without leaving the web application.
I expect the azure page background color to be consistently applied across the main pages of the system, including the lobby and table views.
I expect the midnight blue color to be used consistently for primary UI elements such as buttons, panels, or frames to maintain a coherent visual theme.
I expect the visual layout of the table view to resemble a physical poker table with clearly arranged seats, cards, and betting areas.
I expect player information in the lobby and at the table to be presented in a readable, structured format that makes it easy to see who is in each game.
I expect the lobby to present available game rooms in a list or grid format that allows me to scan multiple rooms and their statuses at a glance.
I expect chat messages to appear in a scrolling conversation view near the table so that I can follow the discussion while watching the game.
I expect key gameplay information such as community cards, my hand, and pot size to be visually emphasized so I can quickly understand the game state.

The game lobby should display available game rooms, current game status, and player information. name: Online Chess Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets me play chess online against others or the computer.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the system will support both games against human opponents and games against a computer opponent within the same interface.
I expect to identify a game I want to join from a list of available online games rather than by manually entering technical identifiers.
I want to specify my move by selecting a source square and a destination square on the board instead of typing chess notation.
I prefer to interact with the chessboard primarily through mouse or touch clicks rather than through keyboard commands.
I assume that moves can only be undone in games where both players or the game rules permit undoing, not in every possible situation.
I want the undo action to be triggered via a dedicated control such as an undo button rather than re-entering previous moves.
I assume that resigning ends the current game session immediately and cannot be reversed.
I expect that when I resign, the game result will be recorded as a loss for me and a win for my opponent in any tracked statistics.
I want theme choices to affect the visual style of the board and pieces while keeping the underlying chess rules unchanged.
I prefer to change board themes through simple clickable controls instead of using configuration files or advanced settings screens.
I assume that difficulty levels apply specifically to games against the computer opponent and not to games against human players.
I want to select a difficulty level using clear, discrete options such as labeled buttons rather than entering numeric values.
I expect the game history to show the full sequence of moves from the start of the game up to the current position.
I want the game history to be displayed in a human-readable format such as move pairs listed in order rather than as raw internal data.
I assume that statistics are accumulated across multiple games played over time rather than being limited to a single session.
I expect the statistics to include at least basic performance indicators such as number of games played, wins, losses, or draws.

I assume the system will allow me to switch between a broad comparison view and a more detailed view of an individual product.
I expect the system to present prices from different states in a single comparative view so that I can easily evaluate differences.
I assume the interface will visually distinguish products and states so I can quickly see which price belongs to which state.
I expect detailed product information to be presented in a structured format where price, quantity, and supplier details are clearly labeled.
I expect the comparison view to align products in a way that makes it obvious when I am looking at the same product across multiple states.
I assume that the lowest-priced options will be visually highlighted or easily recognizable in the comparison results.

name: Supply Chain Traceability Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me understand and verify where my products come from and how they move through the supply chain.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each product can be uniquely identified by a single product ID that does not clash with any other product in the system.
I expect to be able to associate each product ID with basic product metadata such as name, type, and origin at the time of registration.
I expect the system to manage traceability for many products at once rather than only for a small, fixed number of items.
I assume the system will cover the full supply chain lifecycle of a product, from initial registration through final delivery or completion.
I expect the system to capture and store all relevant handover or transfer events that occur as products move between supply chain participants.
I expect each product’s circulation path to include a sequence of locations and supply chain actors involved in handling the product.
I expect the current status of a product to include at least its current location and the party currently responsible for it.
I assume the system will maintain timestamps for key product events so that movements and status changes can be understood in time order.
I expect product authenticity verification to rely on comparing the recorded product history and origin data with what is claimed or expected.
I expect supply chain statistics to be based on aggregated data such as counts of products, movements, and statuses over time.
I expect supply chain analysis results to highlight trends and patterns rather than just listing raw event data.
I expect to be able to look up information about a product by entering its product ID into the system.
I expect to access product status, circulation paths, statistics, and analysis through on-demand queries instead of only receiving scheduled reports.
I assume I can filter and narrow down queries by criteria such as time period, product type, or supply chain participant when viewing statistics or analysis.
I prefer the circulation path of a product to be presented as an ordered timeline or route showing each step in sequence.
I prefer product status information to be displayed in a concise summary view that shows the most important fields at a glance.
I expect data statistics to be shown in an aggregated, visual form such as tables or charts instead of only as lists of individual events.
I prefer data analysis results to include visual elements such as charts or graphs that make it easy to interpret supply chain performance.
I expect authenticity verification results to be presented clearly as a simple outcome accompanied by a brief explanation of the basis for that outcome.

As a user, I want to track the circulation path of products so that I can understand how products move through the supply chain.
As a user, I want to query the current status of products so that I can know their present condition or location in the supply chain.
As a user, I want to verify the authenticity of products so that I can confirm their origin and legitimacy.
As a user, I want to view data statistics about the supply chain so that I can understand its overall operation.
As a user, I want to view data analysis results for the supply chain so that I can gain insights into how it is performing.
instruction: Please implement a supply chain traceability website for tracking and verifying the origin and circulation of products with the unique product IDs. Users should be able to register products, track the circulation path of products, query the current status of products, and verify the authenticity of products. The website should also have data statistics and analysis functions to help users understand the operation of the supply chain. Define the background as misty rose and components as firebrick.

name: Paper Cup Manufacturing Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me oversee and control the production and business operations of my paper cup manufacturing.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify each type of raw material with a unique name or code so I can distinguish between different materials used in paper cup manufacturing.
I want to identify each finished product variant with a unique name or code so I can differentiate between different types or sizes of paper cups.
I want to identify customers by a unique customer identifier so I can reliably link sales and history records to the correct customer.
I want to identify each sales transaction with a unique reference so I can trace and review individual sales records when needed.
I want the system to cover both raw materials and finished products together so that all relevant stock for my business is overseen from a single place.
I want the system to cover both inventory and sales aspects of my operations so I do not need separate tools for stock and sales tracking.
I want the system to manage customer information only to the extent needed to support sales tracking and reporting, not as a standalone CRM with unrelated features.
I want the reporting functions to be based only on data that has been entered or recorded within the system, not on external data sources.
I want inventory records for raw materials to include both quantity and unit of measure so that stock levels make sense for each material type.
I want inventory records for finished products to include quantities that correspond to how I pack or sell cups, such as pieces, sleeves, or cartons.
I want records of raw material usage to include the specific production batches or orders they are consumed in so I can relate usage to production activities.
I want sales records for finished products to include the customer, date, and quantity sold so I can later analyze sales patterns and customer behavior.
I want sales records for raw materials to include the reason or type of transaction so I can distinguish between normal sales and other material disposals.
I want customer records to include basic contact details such as name, phone, and address so I can follow up on orders and maintain relationships.
I want customer sales history to be organized per customer so I can see all past purchases grouped for each customer.
I want production management information to show which finished products were produced, in what quantities, and when they were produced.
I want reports on raw materials to combine inventory balances with usage and sales figures so I can see the complete picture for each material.
I want reports on finished products to include both current stock and historical sales numbers so I can evaluate product performance.
I want sales statistics to summarize sales volumes and values over time so I can quickly assess overall business performance.
I want to record inventory, usage, and sales data through form-based inputs so I can enter information in a structured way.
I want to be able to review and update recorded entries so I can correct mistakes or adjust information when needed.
I want to navigate between raw materials, finished products, inventory, production, sales, and customers using clearly separated sections or menus.
I want reporting and statistics to be accessible on demand rather than automatically pushed, so I can generate them whenever I need insights.
I want to be able to filter and sort records such as inventory lists and sales histories so I can quickly find the information I am interested in.
I want the interface background consistently displayed in light goldenrod so the system visually aligns with my chosen branding.
I want primary UI elements such as buttons, menu items, and key controls to use an olive drab color so the visual theme appears cohesive.
I want reports and statistics to be presented in tabular form with clear labels so I can read and interpret the data easily.
I want inventory and sales views to display quantities and dates prominently so I can assess current status and trends at a glance.
I want the interface to maintain a simple and uncluttered layout so that overseeing production and business operations remains straightforward.

name: Hospital Management Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me centrally manage and monitor all key hospital operations and records.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to cover all major operational areas of the hospital, including finance, pharmacy, laboratory, theater, and patient records, within a single centralized application.

I assume that hospital operations such as finances, inventory, patient records, lab, and theater activities can all be uniquely identified and managed by their existing internal reference numbers, dates, and departmental identifiers.
I expect the same system used for operational management to also be used for reporting, without relying on separate reporting tools.
I want financial information in the system to be detailed enough to support both day‑to‑day transaction tracking and higher‑level financial status review.
I expect patient fee collection data to be tightly linked to individual patient records so that every payment can be traced back to a specific patient and visit.
I want financial reports to aggregate and summarize all relevant financial transactions recorded in the system, rather than requiring manual consolidation.
I expect inventory reporting to cover all consumable and non‑consumable hospital items that are managed through the system, not only medicines.
I want inventory reports to be derived from the same data used for day‑to‑day inventory updates so that there is a single source of truth for stock information.
I expect patient reports to be generated from existing patient records without requiring duplicate or parallel data entry.
I expect all hospital employees who produce daily activity information to use this system as the standard channel for submitting their daily reports.
I assume employees will interact with the system directly to enter their daily reports rather than sending them through intermediate staff or external tools.
I expect employee daily reports to include enough structured details about activities to be understandable and reviewable by their superiors without additional clarification.
I want pharmacy inventory management to include both current stock levels and transaction history such as issues, receipts, and adjustments for medicines.
I expect pharmacy stock information in the system to be considered the authoritative record for medicine availability within the hospital.
I expect patient electronic files to store at least the patient name, visit date, diagnosis, and comments as standard fields for each visit.
I assume that all patient encounters handled by the hospital will be recorded as electronic files in the system rather than kept only on paper.
I want claim formulation in the system to reuse existing patient and financial data instead of entering the same information again when preparing claims.
I expect all hospital claims that are to be managed and processed to be created and tracked within this system.
I want laboratory operations management to cover the registration, processing, and result recording for lab requests handled by the hospital.
I assume that laboratory activities relevant to patient care will be coordinated through the system rather than using separate lab‑only software.
I want theater operations management to handle scheduling and status tracking for surgical or procedure theaters that the hospital operates.
I assume that all formal theater activities requiring coordination and tracking will be recorded in the system instead of using manual logs.
I expect the peach puff background color to be applied consistently across all pages and modules of the system’s web interface.
I assume that indian red will be used consistently for key interface components such as headers, buttons, or highlights in alignment with the hospital’s visual theme.
I want the chosen background and component colors to remain fixed as part of the standard theme rather than being changed dynamically by end users.
I expect users to access all these management and reporting capabilities through a unified web-based interface rather than separate applications per department.
I assume that users will select departments, patients, and operational units from predefined lists in the system instead of entering free‑form text for identification.
I expect the system to support multiple user roles such as general users, employees, and superiors all working within the same hospital environment.
I expect that generating any type of report will be initiated by the user on demand rather than only being generated automatically on a fixed schedule.

instruction: Please implement a hospital management website for managing hospital finances, reports, inventory, and patient information. The website should have financial management functionality, including collecting patient fees and managing hospital finances. The reporting functionality should include inventory reports, patient reports, and financial reports. Employees should be able to submit daily reports to superiors, including detailed information about daily activities. Pharmacy management should include inventory management of medicines. Patient electronic files should include patient name, date of visit, diagnosis, and comments. The website should also have claim formulation, laboratory management, and theater management. Configure the background color to peach puff, with components using indian red.

name: E-Government Integrated Management Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help manage and coordinate various government administrative and decision-making activities in a unified way.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that office, infrastructure, procurement, personnel, financial, and decision-making management together constitute the main administrative domains that must be covered by the unified e-government system.
I expect the same user account to access all management domains in the e-government system without needing separate logins for each module.
I assume that management items in the system can be uniquely identified by standard administrative identifiers such as document numbers, project codes, or application IDs.
I expect each management domain to provide the specific fields and data elements commonly used in existing government paper forms and spreadsheets.
I prefer that similar operations such as creating, viewing, and updating items work in a consistent way across all management modules.
I expect that my ability to submit or approve applications is determined automatically based on my organizational role and not selected manually each time.
I assume that browsing, submitting, approving, querying, and performing related operations are the core interactions that should be available across all relevant management modules.
I expect that when I browse related information about management items, I will see both summary information and a way to access full details if needed.
I prefer to initiate administrative processes directly from the relevant management module rather than going through a separate generic workflow menu.
I expect that approving applications will be possible both from a dedicated approval list and from within the detailed view of an application.
I assume that when I query the status of my applications, I can search using simple filters such as date range, process type, and current status.
I expect that the status of an application will be expressed in clearly understandable administrative terms such as pending, approved, rejected, or returned for revision.
I assume that leave, middle-level cadres leaving Shenzhen, attendance, and five powers management are treated as distinct submodules within the broader personnel or office management areas.
I expect the system to embed all mandatory information required by current government regulations into the designed forms for leave, travel, attendance, and five powers management.
I prefer using predesigned electronic forms instead of uploading external documents or attachments for leave, travel, attendance, and five powers workflows.
I expect that when I fill out a designed form, the system will guide me step by step in the order that matches existing paper-based procedures.
I assume that circulation of forms will follow existing organizational approval chains and not require me to manually define a routing path for each case.
I prefer to be able to see where a form currently is in the circulation chain and who is responsible for the next action.
I assume that the system will automatically use organizational structure information to determine the next approver when circulating forms.

I expect that despite the light pink background and medium violet red elements, text and data will remain easily readable with sufficient contrast.
I prefer that system notifications, status indicators, and important prompts visually fit within the specified light pink and medium violet red color scheme.
I expect navigation between office, infrastructure, procurement, personnel, financial, and decision-making management modules to be available from a common main menu.

name: Employee Attendance Tracker
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me track and review employee attendance.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each employee will be uniquely identifiable in the system so that individual clock-in and clock-out actions can be associated with the correct person.
I expect the system to infer my role (user or administrator) from my account so that I do not have to specify it every time I access attendance functions.
I want the system to handle multiple clock-in and clock-out events per day for a single employee when necessary, rather than restricting attendance to a single daily entry.
I expect attendance records to cover at least complete working days, not just isolated timestamps, so that daily presence and absence can be understood.
I want administrators to be able to access attendance records for all employees within the organization, not just a subset of staff.
I assume the system will maintain historical attendance data over an extended period so that both users and administrators can review past attendance patterns.
I expect each attendance record to include both the date and the specific clock-in and clock-out times so that presence intervals are clearly defined.
I want absence information to be derived from missing or incomplete attendance events within expected working hours rather than requiring separate manual absence entries.
I expect my attendance history view to present entries in a chronological order so that I can easily follow my attendance over time.
I want administrative statistics on attendance to summarize aggregated measures such as counts or averages of presence and absences over chosen time ranges.
I expect administrative analysis features to allow comparison between different employees or time periods so that patterns and trends can be identified.
I assume attendance records visible to administrators will include enough detail, such as employee identifiers and dates, to differentiate between employees and days.
I want clock-in and clock-out actions to be triggered by simple, single-step interactions so that recording attendance does not require navigating through multiple screens.
I expect the system to immediately confirm successful clock-in and clock-out actions so that I know my attendance times have been recorded.
I want to be able to navigate quickly between the attendance recording functions and my attendance history so that I can verify my entries without extra steps.
I expect administrators to have dedicated views or controls for statistics and analysis so that these functions are clearly separated from basic record viewing.
I want my attendance history to be presented in a tabular or list format where each entry clearly shows date, clock-in time, and clock-out time.
I expect absence information in my records to be visually distinguishable from presence information so that I can quickly see when I was not present.
I want papaya whip as the base color to be applied consistently across backgrounds or primary surfaces of the interface so that the theme appears uniform.
I expect dark orange to be used consistently for interactive components such as buttons, highlights, or key UI elements to maintain visual coherence.
I assume that the chosen colors will be applied in a way that keeps text and data in attendance views clearly readable.
I want administrative statistics and analysis results to be displayed in an aggregated, easy-to-scan format such as summary numbers or charts, rather than raw records only.

instruction: Please implement a time attendance system to record employee attendance. The system should have functionalities for employee clocking in and out, and viewing attendance records. instruction: Please implement a recruitment website for hiring drivers and posting job listings. The website should have functionalities for user registration, job posting, job application, and contact form. Users should be able to register and create profiles, apply for jobs, and manage their contact information. Clients should be able to view their active job postings. The website should include pages such as home, about us, clients, drivers, jobs, and contact. Design the site using white as the background and navy for content blocks.

name: Blue-Collar Job Connector
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps connect blue-collar workers with employers looking to hire them.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect that I will identify myself on the platform primarily as an individual worker rather than as a company or recruiter when creating a profile.
I want to provide my name in a way that appears consistently across all parts of the platform where employers see my profile.
I expect that my contact information will be entered through structured fields such as phone number and address rather than as free-text only.
I assume that my email address will be captured as a distinct field within my contact information instead of being buried inside general text.
I want this system to focus specifically on blue-collar roles and not on white-collar or office-based jobs.
I expect the range of job listings to cover multiple blue-collar trades rather than focusing on a single trade.
I assume that job listings will be limited to legitimate employers actively looking to hire, not to training programs or unrelated advertisements.
I want the browsing of jobs to cover opportunities from multiple employers, not just from a single hiring company.
I want my profile to include enough personal and professional information for employers to decide whether to contact me without needing an initial interview.
I prefer to present my skills and qualifications in a structured way that distinguishes between different trades and competencies.
I expect that the skills and qualifications I list will be used by the system to help match or filter relevant job opportunities.
I want the job listings I see to clearly show the job type or trade so I can quickly tell whether a listing fits my work background.
I assume that job listings for roles such as construction worker, plumber, and electrician will be categorized by trade so I can focus on my specific field.
I expect to be able to update or edit my profile information, including name, contact details, skills, and photos, after initial creation.
I want to be able to perform text-based searches on job listings using keywords related to my skills or desired positions.
I prefer to navigate job opportunities through both browsing by category and searching, instead of relying on only one method.
I assume that when I search for jobs, the system will prioritize results that are closely related to my search terms and work experience.
I want to interact with the platform primarily through a website interface rather than needing to install a separate application.
I expect the ivory background color to be consistently applied across all main pages where I view profiles and job listings.
I want interactive elements such as buttons, links, and filters to share the same forest green color so I can quickly recognize actions I can take.
I prefer that the chosen colors for the layout and interactive elements provide sufficient contrast so that clickable items stand out clearly against the background.
I assume that the visual design will remain simple and uncluttered so that my profile details and job listings are easy to read.
I want the layout of my profile and the job listings to remain consistent across different pages so that I do not have to relearn the interface in each section.
I expect that photos I upload will be displayed in a way that complements the ivory and forest green theme without dominating the page.

URL: As a user, I want to create a profile with my name so that employers can identify who I am.
As a user, I want to add my contact information to my profile so that employers can reach me.
As a user, I want to list my skills and qualifications in my profile so that employers can assess my suitability for jobs.
As a user, I want to add my email address to my profile so that I can receive job-related communications.
As a user, I want to upload photos to my profile so that employers can have a better impression of me.
As a user, I want to browse blue-collar job listings so that I can discover available job opportunities.
As a user, I want to search job listings so that I can quickly find positions relevant to my experience.
As a user, I want to view construction worker job listings so that I can apply for construction-related positions.
As a user, I want to view plumber job listings so that I can apply for plumbing-related positions.
As a user, I want to view electrician job listings so that I can apply for electrical-related positions.
As a user, I want the website to use an ivory layout background so that the visual design is consistent with the site’s theme.
As a user, I want interactive elements to be forest green so that I can clearly distinguish clickable or interactive parts of the site.
instruction: Please implement a blue-collar job site that connects blue-collar workers with employers. The website should allow users to create profiles, including name, contact information, skills and qualifications, email address, and photos. Users can browse and search job listings, including construction workers, plumbers, electricians, and more. Apply ivory for the layout background and forest green for interactive elements.

name: Internship Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps connect students with companies offering internship opportunities.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want students to identify relevant internships primarily by viewing key attributes such as title, company name, location, and basic requirements in the listings.
I want companies to identify internships they manage by seeing a list of their own posted positions within the company panel.

I want internship listings to present enough summary information on the browsing page so that students can quickly judge whether a position is worth viewing in detail.
I want each internship posting to include a description of responsibilities, required qualifications, and application instructions so that students understand what is expected.
I want the student panel to show a clear overview of my current applications and their statuses so I can easily track my progress.
I want the company panel to show an overview of each posted internship and the number of applications received for that posting.
I want internship postings to indicate whether they are still open or closed so that students do not attempt to apply to unavailable positions.
I want students to interact with the portal through a personal account in the student panel so that their browsing and applications are tied to their identity.
I want companies to interact with the system through a dedicated company account within the company panel so that only authorized representatives can manage postings.
I want students to be able to initiate an application directly from an internship detail view without needing to navigate to a separate section first.
I want navigation elements like menus or tabs to remain consistent between pages so that I can rely on familiar paths when moving around the site.
I want common actions such as browsing, viewing details, and applying to be reachable within a small number of clicks from the main pages.
I want the mint cream background and teal component colors to be applied consistently across all pages and panels so the interface feels unified.
I want the overall visual design to prioritize clarity and simplicity over decorative elements so that content remains easy to read and understand.
I want navigation controls, buttons, and links to be visually distinct while still staying within the mint cream and teal color scheme.
I want text and interface elements to maintain sufficient contrast against the mint cream background when teal is used as the primary component color.
I want the layout and visual hierarchy to guide my attention first to key tasks such as browsing internships and managing applications.

As a user, I want to apply for internships so that I can pursue internship opportunities.
As a user, I want a student panel so that I can manage my internship browsing and applications.
As a user, I want a company panel so that companies can manage their internship postings.
As a user, I want companies to be able to post internship positions so that new opportunities are available on the portal.
As a user, I want the website to be optimized for speed so that pages load quickly.
As a user, I want the website to be optimized for navigation so that I can easily find what I need.
As a user, I want the website to be optimized for user interface so that it looks clear and consistent.
As a user, I want the website to be optimized for user experience so that using the portal feels smooth and intuitive.

As a user, I want all component colors set to teal so that the interface has a consistent color scheme.
instruction: Please implement an internship portal website that connects students with companies offering internship opportunities. The website should have a student panel and a company panel, where students can browse and apply for internships, and companies can post internship positions. The website should also be optimized for speed, navigation, user interface, and user experience. Choose mint cream for the background; set all component colors to teal.

name: Sports Talent Connect
initial_requirements: I need a platform that helps athletes and sports organizations connect for recruitment opportunities.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I consider athletes and sports organizations to be distinct user types that must be identified separately during registration.
I expect to identify myself as either an athlete or a sports organization at the time of sign-up so that the platform can tailor available actions to my role.
I expect the platform to focus specifically on sports-related recruitment opportunities rather than general job listings.
I want the platform to support multiple sports and not be limited to a single discipline.
I expect each job listing to include enough information for me to judge its relevance, such as role type, sport, location, and basic requirements.
I want athlete accounts to include profile information that organizations can review when evaluating applications.
I expect job applications to be associated with specific job postings so that updates and notifications can be tied to the correct opportunity.
I expect to authenticate with a reusable set of credentials so that I can return to the platform and access my existing data.
I want to be able to review a list of available jobs rather than only seeing a single opportunity at a time.
I expect that applying for a job occurs through an action initiated from the job listing itself.
I want sports organizations to be able to initiate and respond to direct communication with athletes through the platform rather than relying solely on external channels.
I expect notifications to be triggered automatically by events such as new job postings, application submissions, or status changes.
I only expect notifications to relate to my own activities and opportunities rather than all activity on the platform.
I want the ghost white body background to be consistently applied across all main pages of the platform.
I expect slate gray to be used primarily for interactive UI elements and key interface accents rather than as the dominant background color.
I want the color scheme using ghost white and slate gray to remain consistent between athlete and sports-organization views.
I expect notifications and messages to be visually distinguishable within the chosen color scheme so that updates are easy to notice.

As a user, I want to log in so that I can securely access my account and use the platform.
As a user, I want to browse job listings so that I can discover sports opportunities that match my interests.
As a user, I want to apply for jobs of interest so that I can pursue relevant sports positions.
As a user, I want to receive relevant notifications so that I can stay informed about updates related to my applications and opportunities.
As a sports organization, I want to post jobs so that I can recruit suitable athletes.
As a sports organization, I want to communicate with athletes so that I can discuss opportunities and recruitment details.

instruction: Please implement a high-performance sports recruitment platform that connects athletes and sports organizations. The platform should have functionalities for athlete registration, job posting, job application, and message notification. Users should be able to log in, browse job listings, apply for jobs of interest, and receive relevant notifications. Sports organizations should be able to post jobs, and communicate with athletes. Set ghost white as the body background and use slate gray for the UI.

I expect to be able to start a chatbot conversation from any page where I might have questions about courses or enrollment.
I expect the chatbot interaction to be conversational, where I can ask follow-up questions without re-entering all context.
I expect navigation between certification pathway information and individual course pages to be straightforward, with links between them.
I expect the lavender background and indigo components to be applied consistently across all pages, including the course catalog, course details, enrollment, chatbot, and contact form.
I expect the primary interactive elements such as buttons, links, and form fields to use indigo styling so they stand out against the lavender background.
I expect the visual design of the course catalog and course detail pages to be aligned so the transition between them feels seamless.
I expect certification pathways to be presented in a visually understandable format, such as ordered lists or structured layouts, rather than long unstructured text.

The website should have functionalities such as course catalog, chatbot integration, contact form, and certification pathways. Users should be able to browse courses, view course details, enroll online, and contact the institute. Style all pages with a lavender background and indigo components.

name: Data Science Learning Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me learn data science using Python online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify Python data science courses primarily by topics, skill level, and brief descriptions rather than by course codes or technical identifiers.
I assume I will access the system through a personal account that uniquely associates courses, assignments, and grades with me.
I want the system to focus specifically on learning data science concepts and techniques implemented in Python, rather than general programming or non-Python data tools.
I expect the same system to support the entire learning flow from course discovery through enrollment, study, assignment completion, and grade review without needing separate tools.
I assume courses will be structured into clearly defined units or modules so that my learning and assessments can be organized over time.
I expect the course content to include practical Python examples and exercises directly related to data science tasks such as data cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
I assume assignments will be directly linked to the course content I have studied so that completing them reinforces the same data science concepts.
I want the grades I query to reflect my performance across assignments and assessments within each enrolled course, not just a single task.
I expect to be able to choose multiple courses over time and manage my enrollments myself within the system.
I assume the system will allow me to submit assignments directly online rather than requiring offline or manual submission methods.
I expect to access my grades on demand without needing to contact an instructor or administrator.
I assume I will interact with the system through straightforward navigation steps such as browsing, selecting, enrolling, studying, submitting, and checking results.
I want course browsing results to be presented in a way that makes it easy to compare courses by key attributes such as title, level, duration, and brief description.
I expect my grades to be displayed in a clear, organized view that separates different courses and shows individual assignment scores within each course.
I assume the system will visually distinguish between courses I am already enrolled in and courses I have not yet selected.

instruction: Please implement an online learning platform for data science that provides Python data science courses. The platform should have functionalities for browsing courses, learning courses, submitting assignments, and querying grades. Users should be able to browse and select Python data science courses of interest, learn course content, submit assignments, and query their own learning grades. Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to uniquely identify myself in the system using a combination of email address and password during registration and login.
I expect the system to distinguish my role as either a student or a training provider when I create or access an account.

I expect the interface design to clearly differentiate clickable controls from non-interactive content through the use of midnight blue styling.
I expect the overall visual design to remain simple and uncluttered so that the azure background and midnight blue controls do not distract from the content.

instruction: Please develop a student portal website for registration and management of student information. The website should have user registration and profile management features, allowing students to input and manage personal details, qualifications, and career preferences. The website should also have an advanced matching algorithm that matches students with training providers based on criteria such as qualifications, location, field of study, and career interests. Additionally, the website should streamline the application process with an intuitive interface, allowing students to easily apply for programs. Training providers should also be able to access student information based on predefined criteria to enable direct communication and attraction of students to their skills development programs. Establish azure as the main background and midnight blue for the controls.

name: Personal Coaching Match
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me find and work with the right coach to achieve my personal goals.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to identify me as a unique user so that my assessment results, profile data, and coaching activities are consistently associated with me.
I want to specify my personal background and needs through structured fields rather than only through free-text descriptions.
I expect the system to use my personality assessment results as an input to influence how coaches are suggested or matched to me.
I want to identify potential coaches using filters such as expertise area, coaching style, or other relevant attributes when searching.
I want to specify my availability and time preferences as inputs when scheduling or managing coaching sessions.
I expect the system to support an ongoing coaching relationship rather than just a single, one-off coaching interaction.
I want to be able to work with more than one coach over time if my needs or interests change.
I expect my goals and progress to be tracked across multiple coaching sessions, not just within a single session.
I want the system to support both mentorship-style guidance and more formal coaching within the same overall experience.
I expect to be able to define and track multiple goals at the same time rather than being limited to a single goal.
I expect the personality assessment to focus on traits that are relevant to coaching and personal development, not on unrelated psychological diagnostics.
I want my profile to contain enough detail about my background, goals, and preferences for a coach to meaningfully prepare for our sessions.
I expect the coach information shown to me to include coaching specialties, experience, and approach so I can judge suitability.
I want the system to show me only coaches who are currently available to take on new clients when I am searching or being matched.
I expect my goals to be represented in a way that allows them to be broken down into measurable or trackable elements over time.
I want the progress tracking to reflect changes over time using concrete indicators such as milestones reached or sessions completed.
I want to be able to revise or retake the personality assessment if I feel that my answers or circumstances have significantly changed.
I expect to be able to add, edit, and remove information in my profile without needing assistance from a coach or administrator.
I want the matching process to be at least partly automated so that I do not have to manually compare all available coaches myself.
I expect to be able to override automated matching recommendations by manually selecting a coach that I prefer from the available options.
I want to be able to change my selected coach in the future if the coaching relationship no longer feels suitable.
I expect to be able to propose or choose specific time slots when scheduling sessions rather than only accepting fixed options.
I want to be able to reschedule or cancel coaching sessions on my own as my calendar and priorities change.
I expect to be able to create, modify, and retire goals as my coaching journey evolves.
I want to regularly update my progress toward goals, rather than the system changing progress only at session times.
I expect the system to present my personality assessment results in a clear, understandable format that highlights implications for coaching.
I want coaches to see my profile in a concise, organized layout so they can quickly understand my situation before sessions.
I expect coach search and matching results to be shown as a list or similar structure that allows easy comparison between coaches.
I want my scheduled coaching sessions to be displayed on a timeline or calendar-style view so I can easily see upcoming and past sessions.
I expect my goals and related progress to be visualized in a way that makes trends over time easy to understand at a glance.

The application should have functionalities such as personality assessment, user profiles, coaching and mentorship matching, scheduling and session management, and goal setting and progress tracking. Users should be able to complete a personality assessment, create and manage their profiles, search for and select suitable coaches, schedule coaching sessions, and set and track goals. name: Adult Vocabulary Learning Hub

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to be able to specify destinations by selecting a country first and then narrowing down to a specific city.

I want campsite entries to include enough information to judge their suitability for camping, such as the fact that they are designated camping locations.

I want reviews for tourist attractions and campsites to be associated with specific places I have actually visited.
I expect my reviews to be visible to other users who are looking at the same tourist attractions or campsites.

I expect the booking process for tourist attractions and campsites to be initiated directly from the respective attraction or campsite details page.
I want to be able to submit a review through a simple form once I have selected the attraction or campsite I visited.
I expect to interact with the system primarily through a graphical user interface instead of command-line or text-only interactions.
I want tourist attractions and campsites to be displayed in a structured list or grid so I can scan multiple options at a glance.
I expect tourist attractions and campsites to be visually distinguished from each other so I can easily tell which type of place I am looking at.
I want the light pink main background to be consistently applied on both the website and the web app interfaces.
I want medium violet red to be applied to primary controls such as buttons and key interactive elements so they stand out against the light pink background.
I expect the overall visual design to emphasize a friendly, leisure-oriented travel and camping theme consistent with the chosen colors.

I expect to identify my bookings by obvious attributes such as booking ID, car details, and rental dates when reviewing my booking records.
I expect the system to handle both one-time rentals and multiple concurrent or future reservations under the same user account.

I expect the payment section to show all available payment options together so I can easily identify my preferred method.
I prefer a booking flow that guides me step by step from browsing cars to confirming payment without requiring me to navigate unrelated pages manually.
