name: Golf Travel Package Booker
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me plan and book customized golf travel packages.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the homepage form to be directly accessible without requiring login or account creation before I can submit a golf travel request.
I want to specify my golf travel needs in a structured way using fields for dates, destinations, number of travelers, and golf-related preferences rather than entering everything as free text.
I expect to be able to provide both personal contact details and travel preference details in the same request flow so that the system has enough information to respond.

I want the system to handle the full scope of a golf trip, including hotel, flights, local transport, and golf activities, within a single package enquiry instead of treating each component as a separate booking.
I expect to be able to request packages for multiple travelers in one enquiry so that my group can be managed under a single trip.
I expect the same trip request to cover both outbound and return travel rather than requiring separate submissions for each direction.
I want to specify my hotel preferences using criteria such as star rating, room type, meal plan, and proximity to golf courses rather than generic comments.
I want to specify my flight preferences using details like departure airport, preferred times, cabin class, and baggage needs so that the system can filter suitable options.
I want to specify my local transport preferences such as private vs. shared transfers, vehicle type, and pick-up times to ensure the transport matches my expectations.
I want to specify my golf preferences including number of rounds, tee time ranges, course difficulty, and cart or caddie needs so that suggested activities reflect my playing style.
I expect package quotes to clearly list what is included and excluded for each component of the trip so that I can interpret the price correctly.
I expect the digital vouchers to contain all essential reservation details such as dates, times, locations, and confirmation numbers for each booked service.
I want invoices to show a breakdown of costs by component of the golf package rather than a single lump-sum amount.
I expect the system to retain my past preferences so that future package suggestions can reuse my usual hotel, flight, and golf choices.
I want to receive an immediate acknowledgement after submitting a travel request so that I know my enquiry has been captured.
I expect the process from enquiry to booking confirmation to be handled online without requiring phone calls or in-person visits.
I want to be able to review the proposed package details before I commit to confirming the booking online.
I expect my quotes, bookings, vouchers, and invoices to be accessible from a single place in the website so that I do not have to search through emails.
I want the system to use my stored profile and history in the customer relationship management functionality so that I do not have to re-enter the same information for each trip.
I expect my enquiries and subsequent interactions about the same trip to be linked together so that the website can handle them as a single case.
I want the website to communicate with suppliers on my behalf rather than requiring me to contact hotels, airlines, or golf courses directly.
I expect booking confirmations, vouchers, and invoices to be delivered electronically, such as via email or a downloadable link, instead of being sent by post.
I want the homepage form for submitting golf travel requests to be prominently visible on the homepage without needing to navigate through subpages.
I expect the use of whitesmoke for the body background to be applied consistently across all website pages so that the visual style does not change between steps.
I want dark cyan elements to be used to highlight key interactive components such as buttons, headers, and main sections so that important actions stand out.
I expect quotes, vouchers, and invoices to be presented in a clean, readable layout that aligns with the overall whitesmoke and dark cyan color scheme.
I want the website to visually differentiate between enquiry, quote, and confirmed booking states so that I can immediately see the status of my trip.

instruction: Please implement a golf travel package booking website that sells golf travel packages. The website should have functionalities for customer request handling, booking confirmation, online quotes, customer relationship management, and supplier management. Customers can confirm bookings online, and the system will generate digital vouchers and invoices. Assign whitesmoke to body backgrounds and dark cyan to main components.

name: Travel Expense Reimbursement System
initial_requirements: I need a system to help manage and reimburse my work-related travel expenses.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to specify each trip by basic travel details such as destination, dates, and purpose before booking tickets or hotels.
I want to identify each travel expense item with attributes like expense type, date, and amount when it is later used in settlement reports and reimbursement applications.
I expect the system to support only work-related trips and to exclude personal travel from bookings and reimbursements.
I expect the same system to cover the entire travel lifecycle from booking through reimbursement without needing a separate tool in between.
I expect the system to handle multiple trips and their corresponding reimbursements in parallel, rather than only one trip at a time.
I expect ticket booking information such as itinerary, cost, travel dates, and provider details to be available for later use in settlement reports and reimbursement applications.
I expect hotel booking information such as check-in and check-out dates, room rate, and hotel name to be included as expense items in settlement reports.
I expect train booking details such as departure and arrival stations, times, and fares to be included when calculating total trip expenses.
I want settlement reports to aggregate all relevant expenses for a trip into a clear total amount eligible for reimbursement.
I expect settlement reports to include a breakdown of expenses by category, such as tickets, hotels, and trains, instead of only a single combined total.
I expect reimbursement applications to reference a specific settlement report so that the claimed amounts align with previously summarized expenses.
I expect the reimbursement status view to show at least the current state of each application and whether it has been approved or rejected.
I want to initiate travel bookings directly within the system rather than being redirected to external booking tools.
I expect to submit a reimbursement application only after reviewing or generating a settlement report for the corresponding trip.
I want to be able to select which trip or set of expenses to include when generating a settlement report instead of always reporting all historical expenses.
I expect to navigate from a list of reimbursement applications to the detailed view of an individual application's status.
I prefer that booking, reporting, and reimbursement functions are accessible from a unified interface rather than scattered across different systems.
I expect all main content containers across the system to consistently use a white background wherever they appear.
I expect all key interactive components such as buttons, tabs, and primary controls to use navy visuals to align with the specified design style.
I expect the navy component visuals to be clearly distinguishable from the white container backgrounds to maintain visual hierarchy.
I expect the reimbursement status information to be presented in a clear, readable layout that fits the white background and navy component visual scheme.
